documents.document: @HopeLNicholson I look forward to seeing your new skin in photos accompanying articles about the next book you publish. Which when is?
@ReneeStephen @ubermichael Two-metre skeleton of a dinosaur crawling along the floor frightening the cat? What's not to like?!
Thatcher a feminist? Dave never was very bright, was he? https://t.co/lLr8i78hQW
@ubermichael Yeah, like maybe on a cat or something.
@maximum_z "It is not enough that I succeed, but that my friends must also fail."
Just cleaned the bathroom. That mirror is so clean I can see my face in it.
@sinKEVitch @Neilhimself I would love to see this from you gentlemen.
@HopeLNicholson That's why I never let anyone I know read my stuff.
@HopeLNicholson Whoops! You answered my question before I asked it.
@HopeLNicholson "More than if they were strangers" is interesting. Why's that? Do you feel as if your friends have let you down?
@JoshRimer Remember -- you are what you eat!
"Blade Runner 2049" teaser looks ... good, actually. How will they do it without crapping all over the original? https://t.co/MGMvMmHvO7
@ubermichael His most menacing, chilling, crazy moment was before he became the Joker, standing between two guns grinning, "Better be sure."
@ubermichael I'm a big fan of Jack Nicholson, but I was disappointed by his Joker -- self-conscious, mannered, no real menace.
@ubermichael Yer possibly right. They're both ridiculous and make no sense. Ledger was a better Joker than Nicholson and Leto put together.
@BrentSpiner And just think of the product advertisements!
@PoorQuentyn Thanks for the quick reply! I'll check it out.
@HeerJeet Nobody has ever explained why "Eyes Wide Shut" is good. If you'd be so kind ..?
@ubermichael I think the answer is contained in the question.
@shanebee "Why, I wouldn't touch you with a thirty-nine-and-a-half-foot pole!"
A pal's immediate response, when I read this: "Son of a bitch!" https://t.co/deLkRZ2Ls2
@HopeLNicholson "Made them with the skin side inside, made them with the fur side outside." What were Inuit wearing before Gold Rush in '98?
@HopeLNicholson I'm from the Yukon, and I always thought that mitts were mitts -- as long as they're *warm*!
@ColleenDoran The Tweet you quoted is a strange thing to boast about, but fuck that guy.
@maximum_z The odds are much lower if you don't try!
@maximum_z Depends. What year were you hoping to attend?
"Playbill" presents "The Definitive List of the 41 Best-Selling Cast Recordings of All Time": https://t.co/e5xX658l2I
@AskeBay Alas, options to order listings do not exist when looking to buy items.
One good thing you could do, @eBay, is put back the option to order listings by date, price, etc.
Wow, when did @eBay become so ugly and hard to use?
*Everything* needs a grim 'n' gritty reboot -- even (especially!) Lassie! https://t.co/7tlHCLAfu3
@stevecavers These Germans are crazy!
@stevecavers Germanic tribe? Where?! Invading Germanic hordes aren't here again, are they?!
Hey @Adobe! Now Dreamweaver CC 2017 crashes only 50 percent of the time I open it. This is, alas, a great improvement.
@corbett I have observed "force of nature" applied to women and men. I have not tallied how often to whom; might be interesting.
@tarakjpratt Perhaps you're bursting with fruit flavour.
@shanebee "There there, little bunny."
And he still looks the same as he always did: embalmed. https://t.co/3TffCQDNMC
A few minutes ago on The Crescent, Vancouver, BC, an @Amazon truck pulled out without looking or signalling and almost ran me off the road.
Huh. Apparently somebody named @PiersMorgan has more Twitter followers than comedy legend @EricIdle. Well, well, weâ€¦ https://t.co/4UmmEUHATP
Watching Butterscotch Candygram on "Saturday Night Live". Gad, the man just drips charisma.
@dreamweaver Exact steps: Open Dreamweaver. Create new HTML file. Try to type anywhere on screen; nada. Program crashes. Repeat as needed.
So apparently it is not possible to enter text in @Adobe Dreamweaver 2017. Bit of a drawback, that.
I press "Record" on the camera. https://t.co/jT1rod3Mji
@ColleenDoran Enjoyed this series of posts. One day, when you have some spare time (ha!) readers might be interested in seeing some entries.
Aww, "Luke Cage" -- what a disappointment. They rushed it into production, and it shows; godawful second half. Such a shame.
@AdobeCare So you are saying that your own software does not work, and your own update procedures do not work. Good to know.
@AdobeCare No. My fault, trusting your software to do what it claims it will. Why is the default to delete the old version if that's bad?
@AdobeCare No. Both. The app displays the welcome screen ... and goes no further. Eventually Windows 10 reports, "... has stopped working."
@AdobeCare "If it did not install correctly"? How do I find this out, pray tell?
"Luke Cage" continues to dribble away after the halfway point. Stryker and his whole plotline should have been amputated root and branch.
So @Adobe, I have now opened Dreamweaver 60 times and it has crashed on opening 40 times. This is your standard? It works one time in three?
@YoginSuhas @Adobe (This is statistical: I have opened the program 60 times. It has crashed on opening 40 times.)
@YoginSuhas @Adobe Just updated to the new CC2017. To start with, Dreamweaver crashes on opening two out of three times.
Writing in "Luke Cage" takes a precipitous decline in quality in episodes 8 and 9 so far. 13 episodes trying to stretch out 8 eps of story?
Hey @Adobe! When I type a line of text into Dreamweaver and then hit "Enter", I want to start a new paragraph, not delete the text.
What the hell has @Adobe done with Dreamweaver? Is it actually usable any more?
Hey @Adobe! You done fucked up good with CC 2017.
Watching "Luke Cage" and just noticed that as two characters talk about race, the white guy is eating his lunch with chopsticks. Nice touch.
@Viktory79 I'm not from New York and I'm not on the stage, and have no plans to be either, but add me if you'd like; I can't stop you.
@JohnCleese @Minainchina Two lawyers see a pretty girl. One says, "Boy, I'd really like to screw her!" The other says, "Yeah? Out of what?"
Ten years ago is more recent than I think.
@evanjstern Oatmeal-raisin cookies are easier to make than chocolate-chip. It takes forever to peel all those M&Ms!
@mistershrewd I don't think we've had even any new shirtless-Trudeau photos.
And those "actors" in these flickers! If they had any real talent they'd be on the stage, right? https://t.co/m58bLsU9OG
I thought I was wrong once, but I was mistaken.
@evanjstern I'm afraid @jonvoight has been a right-wing-authoritarian bonehead for years. "Midnight Cowboy" is still a good movie though.
@ItsAdamCanuck I'm afraid @jonvoight has been a right-wing-authoritarian bonehead for years. "Midnight Cowboy" is still a good movie though.
@HopeLNicholson Ah! Thank you. My knowledge expands -- I love when that happens.
@HopeLNicholson Aside: What means "ARCs"? Google is not helpful, alas.
@HopeLNicholson Handsome beast!
@ItsAdamCanuck "I have magic breasts!"
The Emmy Awards are tonight! I'm sure the mothers of the winners and nominees are all very proud.
@StacieBee Ah, whenever I hear someone say that, I think to myself, "Boy, that Bowie song holds up pretty well."
@mattdagley Blu-ray player might not recognize exFAT, but will recognize NTFS, which MacOS can use (but beware of creeping file corruption).
@mattdagley Yeah, that's the well-known filesize limit on FAT32. Reformat as exFAT for use on both MacOS and Windows.
@WH_Woolhat @gerryconway Sam Rockwell is so amazing, I'm not sure he isn't played by Tilda Swinton.
"All 47 Woody Allen movies -- ranked from worst to best": https://t.co/dsmBSn2Ey0.
@HopeLNicholson Alas, I fear most creators don't really know who their audience is.)
@HopeLNicholson (I've heard, "Crowd-funding is two parts, but if you don't have the crowd you won't get the funding." How to get the crowd?
@HopeLNicholson Biggest knowledge-gap is usually not how to make campaign, but how to attract backers -- put campaign before interested eyes
Just heard that North Korea has banned sarcasm. Yeah, that'll work.
@MysteryIndie Just because you've lost doesn't mean you have to stop fighting!
@ItsAdamCanuck Also, by "River's last episode", do you mean "Silence in the Library"?
@ItsAdamCanuck Donna's last episode was the saddest of all. She grew as a person, enlarged her world, and then was forced to give that up.
@HopeLNicholson So your cups runneth over?
"Lincoln Park Zoo names baby camel 'Alexander Camelton'": https://t.co/7CxOPSHiRW.
@HopeLNicholson I think that meal is more Chinese than pierogi.
Right to stand still! Left to walk! What's the problem, people? https://t.co/6RLatlAzlg
@mattdagley Well, maybe in Toronto.
@HopeLNicholson Reminds me of Margaret Cho's line: "My problem is that I look this way, but I talk this way."
@NachosaurusRex I find it hard to believe there is such a thing as a good episode of "Voyager". "DS9" was good some of the time.
@NachosaurusRex Yeah, Myer's involvement is a good sign. He's (partly) responsible for two of my favourite "Star Trek" movies.
@NachosaurusRex The last coupl'a TNG movies, "Enterprise", "Voyager", and the last 2 reboot movies have kinda squashed the ol' enthusiasm.
Nostalgia ain't what it used to be. https://t.co/QOPR5fPrOX
@tarakjpratt @akonkin That's not camping! I don't see a single pillow fort.
"What kind of low-budget films break out?" https://t.co/rPPW1SXE2O
Guy on CBC Radio says that Canadians' least-favourite word is "moist". Grrnnrghghgh ..! "Moist". It just feels unpleasant in the mouth.
Panic Mooniverse expands by another small chapter, thanks to @ItsAdamCanuck, @lessicajee, and more!
@nooMcinaP You've got me there. Two of my (many) favourite actors.
